intro: Dysolobium pilosum, commonly known as the hairy dysolobium, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in winter. Dysolobium pilosum is typically found growing on rocky outcrops and in sandy soils, where it thrives in full sun. Due to its unique morphology and restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
